UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Novel bioactive peptides from PD-L1/2, a type 1 ribosome inactivating protein from Phytolacca dioica L. Evaluation of their antimicrobial properties and anti-biofilm activities.
Literature.Author: Pizzo E, Pane K, Bosso A, Landi N, Ragucci S, Russo R, Gaglione R, Torres MDT, de la Fuente-Núnez C, Arciello A, Di Donato A, Notomista E, Di Maro A

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=34µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=136µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=136µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC=68µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizizenii(MIC=136µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538P(MIC=17µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus WKZ-2(MIC=8.5µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=8.5µg/ml),Human colon adenocarcinoma Caco-2(no activity data)
